page.title: 07MILVERTON NEWS IN JUNE
page.content:
ON TUESDAY 4TH JUNE MR NIGHTINGALE FROM RADIO BRISTOL CAME TO CLASS 3 OF MILVERTON SCHOOL. HE TALKED TO THEM ABOUT THEIR FOOD PROJECT. CLASS 3'S PROJECT WAS ABOUT WHICH SCHOOL COULD MAKE THE BEST SCHOOL DINNERS. HE ASKED HOW THEY FOUND OUT WHICH WAS THE MOST POPULAR MEAL (SAUSAGES, CRISPS, BEANS AND JELLY) AND WHAT KIND OF CHART THEY USED. ON WEDNESDAY, 6TH JUNE CLASS 3 WERE ON RADIO BRISTOL.
ON THE 2ND OF JUNE 1985, THERE WAS A WALK FROM MILVERTON TO RADDINGTON. IT WAS ARRANGED BY MILVERTON'S VICAR. SOME PEOPLE WERE BEING SPONSORED TO RAISE MONEY FOR MILVERTON CHURCH, SOME FOR RADDINGTON CHURCH AND SOME FOR ETHIOPIA. IT WAS 9 MILES ACROSS THE COUNTRY, BUT IT WAS MORE LIKE A RAMBLE THAN A WALK. WHEN WE GOT TO RADDINGTON CHURCH WE HAD A SERVICE, WITH A BAND.
